definition: to forget oneself in extravagance/to burn money
to burn/to cook/to stew/to bake/to roast/to heat/to boil (tea, water etc)/fever/to run a temperature/(coll.) to let things go to one's head
to cover/to wrap/to hold/to include/to take charge of/to contract (to or for)/package/wrapper/container/bag/to hold or embrace/bundle/packet/CL:個|个[ge4],隻|只[zhi1]

sentences.english: Should notice to burn a bag to want heat preservation on the technology, temperature is even, when air is wrapped, want ventilated.
sentences.chinese: 技术上应注重烧包要保温，温度均匀，晾包时要通风。

sentences.english: Say, why don't you get married with all this money to burn?
sentences.chinese: 嗨，你的钱多得都烧包了，干吗不讨个老婆？

sentences.english: Cha siu baau is a typical part of the varied Dim Sum dishes.
sentences.chinese: 叉烧包是众多点心中比较经典的一款。

sentences.english: Make burning wrap and be made next.
sentences.chinese: 然后进行烧包和晾包而制成。

definition: ground beetle/(coll.) professional or entrepreneur who, unlike a 海歸|海归[hai3 gui1], has never studied overseas/(dialect) country bumpkin
country bumpkin/boor/unsophisticated country person (humble, applied to oneself)/burial mound
to embarrass oneself/to make a fool of oneself
(Wu dialect) bum/wretched-looking tramp who lives by begging or stealing
